image.altText: Donald Trump points finger at Zelenskyy

props.synopsis: The Ukranian president has left the White House early after diplomatic talks with the US president and vice-president broke down in a fiery, televised clash. Follow live.

title.children: Zelenskyy leaves White House abruptly after fiery Trump talks break down

image.altText: A man in a black jumper and another man in a blue suit and red tie speak and gesture to each other

props.synopsis: The tense Oval Office meeting devolved into a shouting match in front of the world’s media as both leaders repeatedly clashed over the war in Ukraine.

title.children: Trump warns Zelenskyy he's 'gambling with World War III' in angry meeting

image.altText: Pope Francis rests his head on his hand while sitting in a large white wheelchair.

props.synopsis: Pope Francis has had an "isolated breathing crisis" in hospital, the Vatican says, in a setback as the 88-year-old pontiff battles double pneumonia.

title.children: Pope Francis has had 'isolated breathing crisis', Vatican says

image.altText: A close up of a young Thai man looking pensive with foliage in the background.

props.synopsis: Bannawat Saethao's daughter was just one month old when he was kidnapped by Hamas. For the first time, he shares the story of his terrifying capture — and the emotional moment he reunited with his family in Thailand.

title.children: Shot and held by Hamas for 480 days, a Thai hostage breaks his silence

image.altText: Two glasses of beer on a bench.

props.synopsis: The government will pause the biannual indexation of the draught beer excise for two years, a modest change that has been welcomed by the hotel industry.

title.children: Labor to knock less than a cent off a mid-strength pint by freezing draught beer tax

image.altText: A human skull resting in a box

props.synopsis: Across the country, countless sets of human remains sit in storage. Families are hoping the creation of Australia's first independent forensic science service will help solve cases and return remains to where they belong

title.children: Independent forensics lab to target cold cases, mysteries of human remains

image.altText: Australian Dollar coins and notes generic

props.synopsis: The Australian dollar sell-off suggests that while we may be slowly digging our way out of the cost-of-living crisis, global economic storm clouds are gathering.

title.children: The latest Australian dollar sell-off is a red flag for the economy

image.altText: Young woman wearing hijab covering her face in the crowd.

props.synopsis: Anger over slashed government budgets, poor quality of life, career stagnation and rampant official corruption is motivating many Indonesians to fantasise about "running away" from the country.

title.children: Young people fantasise about 'escaping' South-East Asia's largest economy

image.altText: Khaled Sabsabi, with dark hair pulled back and grey beard, stands against brown brick wall wearing dark shirt.

props.synopsis: The decision about Australia's Venice Biennale exhibition is political but it reveals a cycle in which flaws are found in institutions that should be at arm’s length from politics and leaves them too weak to do the job they were established for.

title.children: Art controversy reveals a trend that ultimately weakens institutions

image.altText: A two-storey guard tower sits behind rows of barbed-wire fences running along the border between North Korea and South Korea.

props.synopsis: Sounding somewhere between a wailing ghost or howling wolves, strange and disconcerting noises drift over the border from North Korea into South Korea — sometimes all day.

title.children: 'I'm going crazy': The town being tortured by North Korean noises

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt looks at his seated son who is between his sister in black clothing and his brother in a Marvel top.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne family's distress during a recent travel experience has highlighted different airline approaches to disability seating on flights.

title.children: Qatar Airways rejects child's disability harness 24 hours before flight

image.altText: Image of a younger man with a hat and glasses in front of trees.

props.synopsis: The forced culling of millions of hens has led to egg shortages and rising prices across Australia.

title.children: Bird flu costs one farm 540,000 hens and 'tens of millions' of dollars

image.altText: fire was set off in front of a building while protesters and police standing around the fire

props.synopsis: A protest in Athens has turned violent as hundreds of thousands of people rally across the country on the second-anniversary of Greece's deadliest-ever train crash.

title.children: Clashes erupt in Greece as hundreds of thousands protest deadly train crash

image.altText: Men working to construct a large transmission line tower, land dotted with shrubs, blue sky.

props.synopsis: Cost estimates for Australia's largest energy transmission project have blown out by almost 75 per cent, sparking fears of higher power bills.

title.children: Fears $1.5 billion transmission line cost blowout will increase bills

image.altText: A view from above of a man sitting cross-legged on a prayer mat with a quran in front of him and his hands open.

props.synopsis: Ramadan is a sacred time for Muslims around the world. Here's how non-Muslims can learn more and share the celebration.

title.children: How to support your Muslim friends this Ramadan

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: gene hackman and his wife betsy arakawa

props.synopsis: Hackman, his wife Betsy Arakawa and one of their three dogs were found dead by a maintenance worker who had arrived to do routine work at their Santa Fe home on Wednesday.

title.children: Mystery of Gene Hackman and wife's death deepens as police search house

image.altText: Trump sitting down

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump asks a journalist what he was referring to when he mentioned the acronym "AUKUS" during a White House press conference.

title.children: 'What does that mean?' Trump asks after question on AUKUS

image.altText: Ferrari driver Lewis Hamilton lowers himself into his F1 car, while it is in the garge being worked on

props.synopsis: Pre-season testing often leaves fans with more questions than answers, but what was observed over the past three days can provide some insight into the upcoming season. Here are five key takeaways from Formula 1's pre-season testing.

title.children: Ferrari is all in while others look to the future

image.altText: A woman with a bright pink mullet crowds surfs, she is wearing black jeans and pink crop top.

props.synopsis: Isla Fae Cato thought coming out as transgender would mean abandoning her love of hardcore punk and mosh pits, but she was instead embraced by a community working hard to become more diverse and accepting.

title.children: Hardcore music scene mosh pits create safe space for women, queer fans

image.altText: Bushrangers Andrew George Scott, also known as Captain Moonlite, and James Nesbitt

props.synopsis: In the late 1800s, two bushrangers are suspected to have been in a romantic relationship. Historians say their story is a "rare window" into 19th-century same-sex love.

title.children: 'A love relationship': story of Captain Moonlite reflects NSW's queer history

image.altText: A GWS Giants player and a teen Colombian girl smile and high five each other.

props.synopsis: Young female athletes from a small Colombian town travel to Australia as part of a football exchange program that isn't just about playing the game.

title.children: Colombian teenage girls use Aussie Rules to help shape their future

image.altText: A fishing boat listing on the ocean after crashing into rocks.

props.synopsis: Beaches at a popular New South Wales Far South Coast tourist town have become littered with debris after a commercial fishing vessel ran aground this week.

title.children: Idyllic beaches littered with debris and diesel from NSW shipwreck

image.altText: A US-branded NRL ball sits on the ground, reflected in a puddle.

props.synopsis: Here's how to watch, who's playing and when they take the field as the Jillaroos and England join the NRL action in Las Vegas.

title.children: Rugby league is back in Las Vegas. Here's everything you need to know

image.altText: Antoinette Lattouf speaks to the media outside court.

props.synopsis: Journalist Antoinette Lattouf says the "rot and the systemic racism at the ABC" has been exposed in her unlawful termination case against the national broadcaster as proceedings close.

title.children: Lattouf says court case exposed 'rot and systemic racism at the ABC'

image.altText: An older man in an akubra leaning over a bar with beer glasses in front of him

props.synopsis: For the first time in years, rows of cars and motorcycles line the main street of Many Peaks. They are there for the pub, which recently reopened its doors with a lot of help from the locals.

title.children: Community helps restore country pub after five-year closure

image.altText: A woman in a yellow top and teens clutches her stomach on a couch

props.synopsis: A gynaecologist says he was 'perturbed' by the comments he heard right before going into surgery and diagnosing a woman with debilitating endometriosis.

title.children: Experts 'perturbed' by comments about endometriosis from Marty Sheargold

image.altText: A damaged car with smashed window on a street with concrete shattering

props.synopsis: A suicide bomber has killed at least five people at an Islamic seminary in Pakistan, including the son of the man considered the father of the Taliban.

title.children: Suicide bomb in Pakistan mosque kills top cleric and four others

image.altText: A black building with a big red 7 logo

props.synopsis: The company which has launched an Australian version of the US right-wing streaming channel Newsmax says its latest acquisition, which includes a raft of TV stations, will be run separately to that operation.

title.children: Conservative news operator takes over 7 Tasmania, other television assets

image.altText: A graphic showing a man coughing, a rapid antigen COVID test and three spike proteins

props.synopsis: A study of hundreds of thousands of people hospitalised from COVID has shown increased risk of death more than two years after infection.

title.children: New research reveals long-term health impact of COVID-19

image.altText: A woman in tights and tight dress, holding microphone and smiling as she sings into it, leaning down close to the floor.

props.synopsis: Step inside the theatre of the infectiously energetic Tina Turner musical, as it ends a two-year run in Australia.

title.children: 'Transforming pain into purpose': Tina Turner's triumphs in powerful musical

image.altText: People in snow suits walking through snow carry people

props.synopsis: Eight containers and one shed have been buried under the snow.

title.children: Dozens trapped after avalanche in Indian Himalayas

image.altText: A man in a police uniform, with his arms crossed.

props.synopsis: Queensland Police Commissioner Steve Gollschewski will step down immediately after being diagnosed with cancer.

title.children: Queensland's police commissioner to step down after cancer diagnosis

image.altText: Penny Wong speaks while standing in front of US and Australian flags

props.synopsis: Beijing has signalled a remarkable shift in approach towards Canberra, one that appears aimed at bolstering Labor's prospects in the looming federal election.

title.children: China credits Labor, not the Coalition, with 'digging the well'

image.altText: A man sits on someones shoulders among a crowd at a concert, holding up a large sign.

props.synopsis: At Drake's Brisbane concert this week, Byron Ayton held up a sign that read: "Mum's Cancer Treatment," but the 23-year-old from Port Macquarie couldn't believe it when the star singled him out with a promise to help.

title.children: NSW woman 'blown away' by rapper Drake's offer to cover cancer costs
